strengths: Debate pipeline fully tested with 12 cases covering parseRevisions, identifyDebatePairs, and runDebate in try-debate.test.ts -- real verification, not opinion
Clean pipeline decomposition across 7 try-* modules (agents, invoke, debate, synthesize, metrics, storage, prompt) with single-responsibility boundaries
Four-agent agentic tool_use loop (boris, cat, thariq, lydia) with MAX_TOOL_ROUNDS=5, search_codebase + read_file tools -- genuine compound engineering
weaknesses: P1 from iter-12 partially unresolved: try-invoke.ts fallback path still duplicates validation logic instead of using extractNumber and extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts
applyRevisions in route.ts remains unexported and untested (chronic P4 from iter-12, now 2+ iterations open)
No tests for try-storage.ts, try-prompt.ts, rate-limit.ts, github.ts, or panel-serializer.ts -- 5 untested modules

strengths: npx CLI install path fully scaffolded with root package.json, bin/boardclaude.mjs, and README listing it as Option 1 -- 2-command user journey from install to first audit
Full next-intl i18n with 7 locales (en/es/fr/de/ja/zh/ar), cookie-based locale persistence, LocaleSwitcher in global nav, and proper RTL support for Arabic
Try It Now flow with HeroTrySection offering one-click example repos, auto-redirect to /try, and complete PanelSynthesisView -- zero-friction onboarding in under 60 seconds
weaknesses: Board Builder still has no preview pane -- chronic across 3 iterations; builders work blind without seeing how their panel renders results
@boardclaude/cli npm package is scaffolded but NOT published -- npm view returns 404, breaking the documented primary install path
No persistent Install CLI button in the global nav header -- install action buried in landing page footer

strengths: Genuinely novel multi-agent debate architecture with bounded score revisions and divergence-triggered pair selection in try-debate.ts
Thoughtful adaptive thinking calibration: Thariq at max/20K, Boris/Cat/Lydia at high/10K, Ado/Jason at medium/5K -- proper model-capability alignment
Full metrics instrumentation via MetricsCollector integrated through SSE event interception in route.ts
weaknesses: Cross-iteration context in buildCrossIterationContext() still omits debate transcript summaries from prior reviews (iter-12 P3 unresolved)
BYOK file budget at 400K chars uses only ~10% of the 1M token context window -- conservative for an Opus 4.6 showcase
No use of Claude Agent SDK Agent Teams primitive -- parallel orchestration is custom Promise.allSettled

strengths: All four iter-12 action items resolved: EvaluationList adopted, isRecord/isRepoInfo shared across 5 files, extractStringArray imported in try-invoke.ts
Excellent useReducedMotion support in 7 components with conditional animation objects, 57 ARIA attributes, skip-to-content link, and semantic HTML throughout
usePanelStream.ts implements proper discriminated union reducer pattern with typed SSE event handling and isAgentResult type guard
weaknesses: DivergentOpinions.tsx line 24 uses key={d.topic || i} -- index-as-key fallback anti-pattern for dynamic lists
route.ts lines 142 and 155 use bare 'as Record<string, unknown>' casts instead of isRecord type guard
Async server component pages lack explicit Suspense boundaries for granular streaming of independent sections

strengths: README.md is a masterclass in developer onboarding: 4 install options, visual quickstart demo SVG, command table, 3 screenshots, live dashboard link
Accessibility is production-ready: skip link, useReducedMotion in 7 components, aria-label on 26+ elements, focus-visible in 52 locations, progressbar role with ARIA
examples/ directory exists with 4 high-quality files; CONTRIBUTING.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, issue/PR templates, and MIT LICENSE make this community-ready
weaknesses: TSDoc coverage incomplete: only 11/45 (24%) exported interfaces documented in types.ts -- iter-12 P1 partially resolved
text-gray-400 still used in 111 locations despite iter-12 P3 contrast recommendation -- only 41 instances converted
Examples are all documentation and configs -- no runnable demo project for hands-on experience

strengths: npm CLI package @boardclaude/cli fully configured with bin entry, proper files array, and clear install documentation -- ready for npm publish
next-intl implemented with 7 locales, LocaleSwitcher functional, RTL support for Arabic -- massive leap from iter-12
Narrative clarity remains exceptional: one-sentence pitch, compelling origin story, clear before/after progression
weaknesses: Package NOT published to npm -- npm view returns 404 despite being documented as recommended install method
aria-live regions not implemented (iter-12 P3 unresolved); keyboard shortcuts not documented
7 locale message files are only 30-60% translated -- i18n infrastructure exists but content coverage is partial

top_strengths: Full next-intl i18n with 7 locales, RTL support, and LocaleSwitcher -- massive international expansion since iter-12 (boris, cat, jason agree)
Zero-friction Try It Now onboarding: paste GitHub URL, get full multi-agent evaluation in under 60 seconds without installing anything (cat, ado agree)
169 tests passing with 0 TS errors, debate pipeline fully tested with 12 cases, useReducedMotion in 7 components -- verification and accessibility are production-grade (boris, lydia, ado agree)
Clean 7-module pipeline decomposition with discriminated union reducer pattern in usePanelStream -- correct state management for complex streaming UI (boris, lydia agree)
top_weaknesses: @boardclaude/cli npm package scaffolded but NOT published -- documented primary install path returns 404 (cat, jason agree, highest impact)
TSDoc coverage at 11/45 (24%) exported interfaces -- iter-12 P1 partially resolved but 34 interfaces still lack documentation (ado, boris agree, chronic)
Cross-iteration context omits debate transcript summaries, limiting compound learning across audit cycles (thariq, boris partially agree)
text-gray-400 used in 111 locations despite contrast recommendations; i18n translations only 30-60% complete across 6 non-English locales (ado, jason agree)

agent_a.position: Trust-breaking first impression, highest-leverage single action for user acquisition

agent_b.position: Packaging concern, not architectural -- git clone works fine as fallback

divergent_opinions.analysis: Cat's product lens correctly identifies this as a critical adoption barrier. The README's recommended path being broken undermines trust. Boris is right that it's not an architectural issue, but first impressions matter for community adoption.

agent_a.position: Chronic 3-iteration gap -- builders work blind without visual preview

agent_b.position: Not flagged -- board builder code quality is clean and functional

divergent_opinions.analysis: Cat flags a genuine UX gap that Lydia's code quality lens doesn't capture. The builder works but lacks the feedback loop that makes configuration intuitive.

action_items.action: Publish @boardclaude/cli to npm with npm publish --access public so the documented npx install command works
action_items.impact: Unblocks the primary adoption path. Currently the README's recommended install option returns 404.

action_items.action: Export applyRevisions from route.ts into try-revisions.ts with unit tests covering zero, single, multi, and out-of-bound revision cases
action_items.impact: Closes chronic untested function. applyRevisions has been flagged for 3+ iterations.

action_items.action: Complete TSDoc documentation for remaining 34/45 interfaces in types.ts with @example JSON snippets
action_items.impact: Closes chronic iter-12 P1. Contributors need IDE hover documentation for all type interfaces.

action_items.action: Replace bare 'as Record<string, unknown>' casts in route.ts instrumentedSend with isRecord(data) guard; fix key={d.topic || i} in DivergentOpinions.tsx
action_items.impact: Eliminates last type-unsafe patterns in production code paths.

action_items.action: Add debate transcript summaries to buildCrossIterationContext() in try-prompt.ts
action_items.impact: Enables cross-iteration debate continuity for compound learning.

action_items.action: Complete message translations for es/fr/de/ja/zh/ar locales to full coverage (currently 30-60%)
action_items.impact: i18n infrastructure exists but non-English users see mixed language UI.

action_items.action: Audit text-gray-400 instances and convert to text-gray-300 for small text to meet WCAG AAA contrast
action_items.impact: Closes chronic contrast issue across 111 locations.

improvements: Test count increased from 148 to 169 (+21 tests)
All 4 Lydia iter-12 items resolved (EvaluationList, type guards, extractStringArray, Suspense)
Full i18n with 7 locales, RTL support, and LocaleSwitcher added
npm CLI package scaffolded with bin entry and install script
examples/ directory added with 4 guides (quickstart, minimal panel, custom agent, audit example)
MetricsCollector integrated for tool call and debate tracking
regressions: npm package not published despite being documented as primary install path
